Reviews.Title: Nice!
Reviews.Author: dsp
Reviews.Content: I have owned a few tablets including an acer a500. This is light years ahead of it. My only complaint is the plastic screen. That being said with a screen protector you are set. You also don't have to worry about cracking it. It also takes off some of the weight and that's a good thing. If your like me and you just use it to surf the net and check your email and do every day things. You can't beat the a3 price and features.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Taicheez
Reviews.Content: Have only had for about a week, but this tablet fulfills all my tablet needs. It is fast and clean with very few pre-loaded apps. Great for browsing, email, and most other apps. Not sure about games. It doesn't have as high resolution screen as more expensive tablets, but it doesn't really bother me. It may be noticeable if you sat two tablets next to each other, but the screen is bright and colorful and not pixelated on video playback. The biggest drawback is the charging time. It takes it about 10 hours to fully charge. The battery life seems pretty good. I have not completely tested with video playback. It appears to use about 8% of battery for an hour of netflix over wifi. So their claim of 11 hours maybe pretty close. The case and screen are plastic, so it may not be the most durable tablet available. Based on my experience the performance and price makes this a no brainer. I have used an ipad 3 and while the build quality and screen is better it isn't any faster and overall doesn't make for any better tablet experience.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed.
Reviews.Author: S B
Reviews.Content: The tablet worked fine for all but 1 week. Then the screen started flickering. We tried having it plugged in, working off the battery charge, having it in hand, put flat on the table. Turning it off, back on - nothing worked. It flickers once or twice and goes black, but doesn't shut off. It is impossible to work with, we had to return it.I understand that there might be manufacturer defects, I wanted a replacement of the same make and model. Amazon did not have that option available. Only return for refund (after having bought accessories). I paid roughly $250 for this tablet, the one available now is $280 sold by another seller. Amazon has it listed for $455 as of the moment I submitted my return request.I really want to give this tablet a shot, but I find it unreasonable for such a big company not to be able to send me a replacement but rather have me go somewhere else. Not to mention, the purchase was a gift, that I had to rush overnight and pay premium shipping and it only lasted a week.This review goes for both - the way the Acer A3 worked (or rather didn't) and the way Amazon handled the replacement request.
